translated: It is the Dharma Body because it is the Dharma and it is a Body, having the characteristics as explained.

original: chos kyi sku de rnams la gang gi tshe sgrub pa pos gang zhig bsgom par 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de rnams la gang gi tshe sgrub pa pos gang zhig bsgom par 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the practitioner wishes to cultivate that Dharma Body,

original: ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: it is the Body of Knowledge.

original: chos nyid tsam bshad par bya ste /🔽sku de yang gsang ba la @278a * //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam bshad par bya ste / sku de yang gsang ba la @278a * //
translated: The nature of reality alone is to be explained.

original: sogs pa'i tshig gis bstan to //🔽longs spyod pas na longs spyod de /
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshig gis bstan to // longs spyod pas na longs spyod de /
translated: That Body is also taught by the words “secret” and so forth.🔽It is the Enjoyment Body because it enjoys.

original: ro rjes su myong ba de nyid kyi sku yin pas na /
analyzed: ro rjes su myong ba de nyid kyi sku yin pas na /
translated: It is the Body of that enjoyment,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: so it is the Complete Enjoyment Body.

original: gang gi tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de rnams sgrub pa pos 'dod pa de'i tshe bdag gi longs spyod bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de rnams sgrub pa pos 'dod pa de'i tshe bdag gi longs spyod bstan pa yin te /
translated: When the practitioner wishes for those Enjoyment Bodies, then the enjoyment of the self is taught.

original: longs spyod de yang nam mkha' lding gi gdong gis btung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod de yang nam mkha' lding gi gdong gis btung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That enjoyment is also said to be “drunk by the face of the garuḍa” and so forth.

original: sprul pa nas sprul pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa nas sprul pa ste /
translated: Emanation is the emanation,

original: sangs rgyas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bskyed pa'o //
translated: the generation of the Buddha.

original: sprul pa de dag mang bas na /
analyzed: sprul pa de dag mang bas na /
translated: Since those emanations are many,

original: sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: there is the Emanation Body.

original: sprul pa'i sku de rnams bsgrub par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku de rnams bsgrub par 'dod pa la /
translated: For those who desire to accomplish those Emanation Bodies,

original: sprul ba bshad par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽sprul pa de yang lte bar dgod pa dpa' bo ni /
analyzed: sprul ba bshad par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro // sprul pa de yang lte bar dgod pa dpa' bo ni /
translated: the explanation of the emanations is to be applied.🔽That emanation is also taught as the hero who is placed at the navel,

original: 'jigs byed chen po'i sku gzugs can la zhes bya ba der bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po'i sku gzugs can la zhes bya ba der bstan to //
translated: the form of the Great Fierce One.🔽Thus, the yogi/nī who meditates like that will attain the state of Heruka,

original: de ltar sgom pa po ste rnal 'byor pa ye shes dang longs spyod dang sprul pa des thob par 'gyur zhing ci srid he ru ka'i bdag nyid du rnal 'byor pa 'grub ces bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sgom pa po ste rnal 'byor pa ye shes dang longs spyod dang sprul pa des thob par 'gyur zhing ci srid he ru ka'i bdag nyid du rnal 'byor pa 'grub ces bya bar bstan to //
translated: and the yogi/nī will accomplish the state of Heruka.

original: yang na sku gsum zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gsum ste /🔽sku gsum lus kyi dbus su ni //
analyzed: yang na sku gsum zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gsum ste / sku gsum lus kyi dbus su ni //
translated: Or, the “three bodies” are the three wheels.🔽The three bodies are taught

original: 'khor lo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin //
translated: as the form of the wheels in the middle of the body.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the verse.

original: sku gsum po de yang nges pa can gyi gnas te /
analyzed: sku gsum po de yang nges pa can gyi gnas te /
translated: Those three bodies are the definite places,

original: skye gnas snying ga mgrin spyi bor //
analyzed: skye gnas snying ga mgrin spyi bor //
translated: the birthplaces, the heart, throat, and head,

original: sku gsum po ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: sku gsum po ni rnam par gnas //
translated: where the three bodies are located.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de la sprul pa skye gnas 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de la sprul pa skye gnas 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therein, the emanation wheel is in the secret place.

original: snying gar chos kyi 'khor lo yin //
analyzed: snying gar chos kyi 'khor lo yin //
translated: The Dharma wheel is in the heart.

original: mgrin par longs spyod 'khor lo ste //
analyzed: mgrin par longs spyod 'khor lo ste //
translated: The enjoyment wheel is in the throat.

original: bde ba chen po mgo la gnas //
analyzed: bde ba chen po mgo la gnas //
translated: The great bliss wheel is in the head.

original: 'khor lo de dag sngags dang 'dab ma'i khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'i padma 'dab mar bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo de dag sngags dang 'dab ma'i khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'i padma 'dab mar bcas pa'o //
translated: Those wheels are lotuses with a specified number of petals, distinguished by their mantras.

original: de la skye gnas kyi 'khor lo ni 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la skye gnas kyi 'khor lo ni 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Therein, the emanation wheel has sixty-four petals.

original: snying ga'i 'khor lo ni 'dab ma brgyad do //
analyzed: snying ga'i 'khor lo ni 'dab ma brgyad do //
translated: The heart wheel has eight petals.

original: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo ni 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo ni 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment wheel has sixteen petals.

original: de bzhin du yang bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bshad pa /
translated: And also it is explained:

original: dang po 'dab ma drug cu bzhi //
analyzed: dang po 'dab ma drug cu bzhi //
translated: The first has sixty-four petals.

original: gnyis pa 'dab ma brgyad du bshad //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'dab ma brgyad du bshad //
translated: The second is said to have eight petals.

original: gsum pa bcu drug par shes bya //
analyzed: gsum pa bcu drug par shes bya //
translated: The third should be known to have sixteen petals.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth has thirty-two petals.🔽Thus it is stated.

original: zhes bya ba 'dab ma'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dab ma'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinction of the number of petals.

original: sde tshan brgyad dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The first is endowed with eight classes.

original: sde tshan gyi gtso bo ni sprul pa la'o //
analyzed: sde tshan gyi gtso bo ni sprul pa la'o //
translated: The chief of the classes is in the emanation wheel.

original: dbyangs lnga dang ldan pa'i yi ge lnga dang / ya ra la wa rnams ni chos la'o //
analyzed: dbyangs lnga dang ldan pa'i yi ge lnga dang / ya ra la wa rnams ni chos la'o //
translated: The five vowels and the five consonants, and the ya, ra, la, and va, are in the Dharma.

original: ma ning gi yi ge bzhi dang bcas pa'i tshangs pa ni mgrin par ro //
analyzed: ma ning gi yi ge bzhi dang bcas pa'i tshangs pa ni mgrin par ro //
translated: The four neuter consonants and the Brahma are in the throat.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ni //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ni //
translated: In the center of the emanation wheel

original: sde @278b tshan brgyad kyis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: sde @278b tshan brgyad kyis yongs su bskor //
translated: is surrounded by the eight classes.

original: gsang sngags rnams ni bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnams ni bskyed pa ste //
translated: The mantras are generated

original: gzhan dag gang ci 'ang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gang ci 'ang rung ba'o //
translated: and whatever else there is.

original: dbyangs lnga dang ni yang dag ldan //
analyzed: dbyangs lnga dang ni yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the five vowels

original: ya ra la bas rnam brgyan pa //
analyzed: ya ra la bas rnam brgyan pa //
translated: and adorned with ya, ra, la, and va,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste //
translated: it is called the Dharma wheel,

original: lus ldan rnams kyi yid dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lus ldan rnams kyi yid dga' ba'o //
translated: pleasing to the minds of those with bodies.

original: cha ni bzhi par yang dag ldan //
analyzed: cha ni bzhi par yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the four parts,

original: kun du yongs su bskor bar bya //
analyzed: kun du yongs su bskor bar bya //
translated: it is completely surrounded.

original: ro rnams kun gyi bzhi shes par //
analyzed: ro rnams kun gyi bzhi shes par //
translated: Knowing the four of all the tastes,

original: longs spyod 'khor lo yang dag bstan //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khor lo yang dag bstan //
translated: the enjoyment wheel is rightly taught.

original: 'khor lo gsum du brjod pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum du brjod pa'i rjes la /
translated: After the three wheels have been described,

original: rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i las bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i las bstan par bya ste /
translated: the actions taught in other tantras should be taught.

original: gsang sngags 'di yi snying po ni //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di yi snying po ni //
translated: The essence of this mantra

original: bshad kyis sgrub po rnams nyon cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bshad kyis sgrub po rnams nyon cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is explained, so listen, you adepts!

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sngags las bla na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sngags las bla na med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the unexcelledness of the mantra just explained,

original: snying po zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi las nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi las nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: it is called the “essence,” and the mantra’s activity is to be applied to the statement “listen!”

original: snying po bzlas pas dpag tshad bye ba 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snying po bzlas pas dpag tshad bye ba 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By reciting the essence, one will fly ten million leagues.

original: las 'di dag thams cad la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skye ba bdun gyi sha dang / sku gsum gyi shes par bya'o //🔽dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: las 'di dag thams cad la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skye ba bdun gyi sha dang / sku gsum gyi shes par bya'o // dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: All of these activities and so forth should be understood from the flesh of the seven-lived one and the three bodies that will be explained.

original: sku gsum grub pa'i snying po'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: sku gsum grub pa'i snying po'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This has been chapter ten, the ritual action mantra section of the essence of the three bodies, from the commentary on the glorious Wheel of Time called Jewel Heap.

original: // / sku gsum sgrub pa'i sgo nas las rnams brjod nas /
analyzed: // / sku gsum sgrub pa'i sgo nas las rnams brjod nas /
translated: Having described the activities through the practice of the three bodies,

original: de grub kyang las gzhan rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de grub kyang las gzhan rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the other activities that are accomplished by that,

original: le'u bcu gcig pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Chapter XI

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, moreover, it is explained, etc.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /🔽gang zhig bstan pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na / gang zhig bstan pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: What is that like?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By whom, merely through the teaching, etc.

original: bshad pa tsam gang gis /
analyzed: bshad pa tsam gang gis /
translated: By whom, merely through the teaching,

original: myur du dngos grub 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: myur du dngos grub 'jug pa yi //
translated: quickly enters into power, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: is easy to understand.🔽Thus, where is that which is difficult to find in the three realms found?🔽When asked, by which person the fragrant dust becomes, etc.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i khams gsum na rnyed par dka' ba gang du rnyed ces dris pa dang / skyes bu gang zhig rdul dri zhim par gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdul dri zhim pa byung ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i khams gsum na rnyed par dka' ba gang du rnyed ces dris pa dang / skyes bu gang zhig rdul dri zhim par gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdul dri zhim pa byung ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par byas pa'o //
translated: The distinction is made by the special occurrence of the fragrant dust.

original: skye ba bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The seven-times-born, etc.

original: skye ba rnam pa bdun gang la yod pa de ni skye ba bdun pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa bdun gang la yod pa de ni skye ba bdun pa'o //
translated: That which has seven kinds of birth is the seven-times-born.

original: mi 'ba' zhig gi skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mi 'ba' zhig gi skye ba yin gyi /
translated: It is the birth of a human being alone.

original: lha ma yin dang / yi dags dang byol song la sogs pa gzhan du skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / yi dags dang byol song la sogs pa gzhan du skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not born as a god, or as a demigod, or as a hungry ghost, or as an animal, and so on.

original: de ltar yin na yin mod des ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yin mod des ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What if that is so?

original: de bsten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba @279a * //
analyzed: de bsten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba @279a * //
translated: If one relies on that, and so on.

original: bdun pa de bshugs nas yang dag par srung ba byas pa la /
analyzed: bdun pa de bshugs nas yang dag par srung ba byas pa la /
translated: Having sung that, one should properly protect the seven-times-born.

original: snying gi go ro tsa na gur gum gyi mdog can skye ba bdun pa de'i snying po ni mchog der ro //
analyzed: snying gi go ro tsa na gur gum gyi mdog can skye ba bdun pa de'i snying po ni mchog der ro //
translated: The essence of the seven-times-born, whose heart is the size of a saffron flower, is the supreme.

original: ro tsa na ni gsal ba'i ngang tshul can rtog pa thams cad rnam par 'dzoms par byed pa khams gsum gyi sku gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab po //
analyzed: ro tsa na ni gsal ba'i ngang tshul can rtog pa thams cad rnam par 'dzoms par byed pa khams gsum gyi sku gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab po //
translated: The essence is the nature of clarity, which causes all concepts to be totally destroyed, the wisdom that is the nature of the single body of the three realms.

original: de ni rang blo dang 'brel pa'i snying rje dang gnyis su med pa blangs nas dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i gsang sngags kyi sgra tsam gyis lan bdun bzlas pa'i thig les khams gsum du khyad par du gyur pa gang gis byed pa ni las thams cad byed🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rang blo dang 'brel pa'i snying rje dang gnyis su med pa blangs nas dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i gsang sngags kyi sgra tsam gyis lan bdun bzlas pa'i thig les khams gsum du khyad par du gyur pa gang gis byed pa ni las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taken that with nondual compassion related to one's own mind, the one who is distinguished in the three realms by the drops of the mere sound of the essence mantra of glorious Heruka repeated seven times will perform all actions.

original: lta ba 'dis phyi dang nang gi phyogs thams cad dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i cho gas zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: lta ba 'dis phyi dang nang gi phyogs thams cad dbang du byed par 'gyur ro // dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i cho gas zhes bya ba las /
translated: This view will bring all external and internal directions under one's control.

original: skye ba bdun pa'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on chapter 11, the chapter on the ritual action of the seven-times-born, from the Jewel Lamp Commentary on the glorious “Shri Herukabhidhana Tantra.”

original: // / snying pos skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par byas nas /
analyzed: // / snying pos skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par byas nas /
translated: Having described the characteristics of the seven-times-born through the essence [mantra],

original: nye ba'i snying pos kyang brjod par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i snying pos kyang brjod par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: in order to describe [them] also through the near essence [mantra], chapter 12 will be explained.

original: de nas nye ba'i snying po ni //
analyzed: de nas nye ba'i snying po ni //
translated: Now, the near essence

original: dngos grub thams cad sgrub byed bshad //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad sgrub byed bshad //
translated: is explained as accomplishing all powers.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: snying po dang nye ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: snying po dang nye ba'i snying po ste /
translated: Essence and near essence

original: nye ba dang nye ba'i mtha' can no //
analyzed: nye ba dang nye ba'i mtha' can no //
translated: are the near and the near end.

original: des ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done by that?

original: 'jig rten gsum na gang cung zad //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gang cung zad //
translated: Whatever there is in the triple world

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: lus dang ngag yid mtho ris dang // sa bla dang sa 'og gi gzugs kyis spros pa ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid mtho ris dang // sa bla dang sa 'og gi gzugs kyis spros pa ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The triple world is the body, speech, and mind, with the forms of the upper, middle, and lower realms.

original: 'jig rten gsum kho na ni 'jig rten gsum po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum kho na ni 'jig rten gsum po ste /
translated: The triple world itself is the triple world.

original: 'jig rten gsum po de la gang ci yod pa de mnga' ba'i phyir ma rtogs shing mngon par 'dod pa'i las de thams cad 'grub par byed ces bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po de la gang ci yod pa de mnga' ba'i phyir ma rtogs shing mngon par 'dod pa'i las de thams cad 'grub par byed ces bya ba'i don te //
translated: Since he has power over whatever exists in the triple world, it means he accomplishes all the karma that is not understood and is desired.

original: gang gis las bshad pa'i nye ba'i snying po ni gsang sngags de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis las bshad pa'i nye ba'i snying po ni gsang sngags de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mantra that is the near essence explained by that?

original: tapha zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tapha zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Tpha and so on should be stated in reverse order.

original: thub pa'i snying po nye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di 'bum bzlas pas mkhas pa 'dar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thub pa'i snying po nye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di 'bum bzlas pas mkhas pa 'dar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting this mantra, called the heart of the Sage, the proximate heart, one hundred thousand times, one becomes learned.

original: lha dang lha ma yin dang klu rnams 'gugs par byed do zhes de nye ba'i snying po gsang sngags skye ba bdun gyi dam tshig gi mthu 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin dang klu rnams 'gugs par byed do zhes de nye ba'i snying po gsang sngags skye ba bdun gyi dam tshig gi mthu 'dir bstan to //
translated: It attracts gods, demigods, and nāgas. Thus, this proximate heart, the power of the pledge of the seven-born mantra, is taught here.

original: sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang bsgrub bya dbab pa'i cho ga'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang bsgrub bya dbab pa'i cho ga'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the forty-second chapter on the mantra, the yantra, and the ritual for summoning the victim.

original: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i @279b dga' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i @279b dga' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: In the glorious Cakrasaṃvara commentary called Ratna-āvali,

original: nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: this is the twelfth chapter on the ritual actions of the proximate heart.

original: // / nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga bstan nas /
analyzed: // / nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the ritual actions of the proximate heart,

original: go cha'i las kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: go cha'i las kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the armor actions as well,

original: la'u bcu gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: la'u bcu gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: the thirteenth chapter should be explained.

original: de nas go cha'i las mchog ni //
analyzed: de nas go cha'i las mchog ni //
translated: Next, the supreme armor actions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la go cha'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la go cha'i sngags so //
translated: In this way, etc., is the armor mantra.

original: sngar btus pa bshad par bya ba nye ba'i snying po dang mnyam zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar btus pa bshad par bya ba nye ba'i snying po dang mnyam zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the near essence, which was previously collected, he says:

original: 'jig rten gsum na gang yod pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gang yod pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Whatever exists in the three worlds,

original: khams gsum mam yid la yongs su yod pa cho ga des 'di thams cad sgrub par byed pas nye ba'i snying po dang mtshungs par bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum mam yid la yongs su yod pa cho ga des 'di thams cad sgrub par byed pas nye ba'i snying po dang mtshungs par bsngags pa yin no //
translated: By this rite, all of that is accomplished, and so it is praised as being equal to the near essence.

original: sku gsum dang skye ba bdun pa'i sbyor bas snying po dang nye ba'i snying pos bshad pa'i las byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sku gsum dang skye ba bdun pa'i sbyor bas snying po dang nye ba'i snying pos bshad pa'i las byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The essence and near essence are not explained by the application of the three bodies and the seven births.

original: cho ga 'di ni zlos bzhin du lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni zlos bzhin du lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This rite, while reciting, on the path, etc., is stated.

original: las kyi tshogs 'dis ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi tshogs 'dis ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is this aggregate of rites to be done?

original: dbang po gang dang gang lam gyur ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po gang dang gang lam gyur ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Whatever is the path of the senses,

original: dbang po rnams kyi lam ni dbang po'i sgo'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi lam ni dbang po'i sgo'o //
translated: The path of the senses is the door of the senses.

original: de rnams rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las ni dbang bo'i lam nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las ni dbang bo'i lam nyid do //
translated: The function of their full engagement is the path of the senses.

original: gang dang gang du gyur cing thob pa de rnams ni bdud rtsi lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang du gyur cing thob pa de rnams ni bdud rtsi lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Wherever they occur and are obtained, they are the nature of the five nectars.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas lnga yis nges par sbyar ba ste mchog tu mnyam par sbyor ba des 'di dag thams cad du bdud rtsi lnga sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas lnga yis nges par sbyar ba ste mchog tu mnyam par sbyor ba des 'di dag thams cad du bdud rtsi lnga sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoga of equipoise is the yoga of the five buddhas, and by that supreme yoga, all of these become the nature of the five nectars and the buddhas.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i bdud rtsis gsang ba rtogs par bya'o //🔽dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i bdud rtsis gsang ba rtogs par bya'o // dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: By that nectar, the secret should be realized.

original: cho ga'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: cho ga'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the thirteenth chapter of the Sri-Cakrasamvara, called “The Ritual Action of the Mantra.”

original: // / snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang cho ga dag gis nges pa can gyi dam tshig gi las rnams brjod par byas nas /
analyzed: // / snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang cho ga dag gis nges pa can gyi dam tshig gi las rnams brjod par byas nas /
translated: Having described the ritual actions of the pledges by means of the essence mantras, the near essence mantras, and the rituals, now, in response to the question, “What are the pledges?”

original: sgrub pa po rnams kyi las grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnams kyi las grub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to accomplish the rites of the adepts,

original: sgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u bcu bzhi pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u bcu bzhi pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: the fourteenth chapter is taught, the one that teaches the rites.

original: sgrub pa de ni bshad par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa de ni bshad par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That rite will be explained.

original: sgrub pa pos bsgrub cing blo dang mi 'gal bar byed pas na bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bsgrub cing blo dang mi 'gal bar byed pas na bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The adept is one who accomplishes and does not contradict the mind.

original: de'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its distinction,🔽it is said, “by which the adept is accomplished,” by which the adept is certainly made fit.

original: gang gis sgrub po 'grub pa zhes bya ba la gang gis sgrub pa po nges par snod du rung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sgrub pa @280a * //
analyzed: gang gis sgrub po 'grub pa zhes bya ba la gang gis sgrub pa po nges par snod du rung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sgrub pa @280a * //
translated: That kind of rite,

original: bdag gis bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: I will explain.

original: de lta yin na bzang mod kyi 'on kyang de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na bzang mod kyi 'on kyang de gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is good, but still, what is that?

original: bong bu'i rnam pa'i rnal 'byor bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bong bu'i rnam pa'i rnal 'byor bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The self-yoga of the form of an ass, etc.

original: bong bu'i gdong ni bong bu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bong bu'i gdong ni bong bu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The face of an ass is the form of an ass.

original: dper na snam bu tshig ces bya ba der phyogs gcig tshig pa la thams cad kyi sgra 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snam bu tshig ces bya ba der phyogs gcig tshig pa la thams cad kyi sgra 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when it is said, “The cloth is burned,” the word all is used even when only one part is burned.

original: de'i phyir dpal bde mchog las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpal bde mchog las /
translated: Therefore, in the glorious Cakrasaṃvara,

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi gdong tsam gyis bong bu yin te bong bu'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi gdong tsam gyis bong bu yin te bong bu'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid bshad do //
translated: it is explained that the face of the form that is not other is the donkey, the nature of the application of the aspect of the donkey.

original: dpal he ru ka shin tu mdzes pa yin na /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka shin tu mdzes pa yin na /
translated: If the glorious Heruka is very handsome,

original: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa'i gdong du bsgyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa'i gdong du bsgyur zhe na /
translated: why is he made into an ugly face?

original: yid kyi shugs las bzlog bya'i phyir //
analyzed: yid kyi shugs las bzlog bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to turn back the force of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is stated and so forth.

original: yid kyi shugs ni mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi shugs ni mgyogs pa'o //
translated: The force of the mind is speed.

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir zhes dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir zhes dgos pa bstan to //
translated: In order to turn that back, the purpose is taught.

original: gang gi phyir yid ni thams cad song zhing bzlog par dka' ba des rnal 'byor pa de grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma grub pas bsgrub pa de ni ma grub pa zhes pa'i rig pa las bshad pa'i las rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid ni thams cad song zhing bzlog par dka' ba des rnal 'byor pa de grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma grub pas bsgrub pa de ni ma grub pa zhes pa'i rig pa las bshad pa'i las rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the mind goes everywhere and is difficult to turn back, the yogin will not be successful. Therefore, the activities explained in the Vidyātantra, “The unaccomplished is accomplished by the unaccomplished,” will not be successful.

original: de bas na bdag nyid sgrub pa'i phyir dang yid kyi shugs zlog par byed pa'i bong bu'i rnam pa bsgom par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bstan to //🔽ci bcom ldan 'das gcig pu kho na bong bu'i gdong can yin nam /
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid sgrub pa'i phyir dang yid kyi shugs zlog par byed pa'i bong bu'i rnam pa bsgom par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bstan to // ci bcom ldan 'das gcig pu kho na bong bu'i gdong can yin nam /
translated: Therefore, in order to accomplish oneself and to stop the force of the mind, the donkey-faced one is taught.

original: gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na /
translated: Is only the Blessed One donkey-faced, or others as well?

original: rnal 'byor pa ni l'a ma'i gzugs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni l'a ma'i gzugs //
translated: The yoginī is the form of Lāmā,

original: de bzhin du ni mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: and likewise the ḍākinī,

original: khanda ro h'a 'dod gzugs can //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khanda ro h'a 'dod gzugs can // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: The yoginī is the Blessed Lady Vajravārāhī.

original: l'a ma la sogs pa ni rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: l'a ma la sogs pa ni rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Lāmā and so forth are well-known.

original: de'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang rdo rje phag mo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang rdo rje phag mo ste /
translated: Therefore, the four ḍākinīs and Vajravārāhī,

original: lnga dang dpal chen bde mchog dang drug ni bong bu'i gdong can du bstan to //
analyzed: lnga dang dpal chen bde mchog dang drug ni bong bu'i gdong can du bstan to //
translated: the five, and the Great Glorious Cakrasaṃvara, the sixth, are taught to be donkey-faced.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinction of the ḍākinīs,🔽it is said:

original: khrag dang rkang dang rtse gsum bsgoms pa ni mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: khrag dang rkang dang rtse gsum bsgoms pa ni mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: The blood, bone, and trident yogas are the dakinis.

original: ral gri'am rtse gsum bsnams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ral gri'am rtse gsum bsnams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that they hold a sword or a trident.

original: drug gi zhal ni bshad la sum cu rtsa gcig ni ma bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: drug gi zhal ni bshad la sum cu rtsa gcig ni ma bshad mod kyi /
translated: The six faces have been explained, but the thirty-one have not.

original: de tsam gyis dngos grub rtogs par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis dngos grub rtogs par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is it the case that one realizes power by that much?

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las kyang sum cu rtsa bdun gyi zhal gsungs pa la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las kyang sum cu rtsa bdun gyi zhal gsungs pa la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: One should enter the thirty-seven faces taught in the explanatory tantra.

original: seng ge'i gdong can ni sku'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i gdong can ni sku'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The lion-faced one is in the body wheel.

original: rma bya'i gdong can ni gsung gi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i gdong can ni gsung gi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The peacock-faced one is in the speech wheel.

original: nam @280b mkha' lding gi gdong can ni thugs kyi 'khor la'o //
analyzed: nam @280b mkha' lding gi gdong can ni thugs kyi 'khor la'o //
translated: The garuda-faced one is in the mind wheel.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa bzhi ni khva dang 'ug pa dang khyi dang phag gi gdong can no //
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa bzhi ni khva dang 'ug pa dang khyi dang phag gi gdong can no //
translated: The four beginning with the crow-faced one are crow, owl, dog, and pig faced.

original: gshin rje sreg ma la sogs pa mtshams kyi lha mo ni ma he'i gdong can no //
analyzed: gshin rje sreg ma la sogs pa mtshams kyi lha mo ni ma he'i gdong can no //
translated: The goddesses in the intermediate directions beginning with Yama-roasting are buffalo faced.

original: de lta yin du zad mod kyi bong bu'i rnam pa'i gdong 'di dngos su byas pas ci 'grub ci na /
analyzed: de lta yin du zad mod kyi bong bu'i rnam pa'i gdong 'di dngos su byas pas ci 'grub ci na /
translated: What is accomplished by this face in the form of an ass?

original: tshe zad ba dang tshe ring ba //
analyzed: tshe zad ba dang tshe ring ba //
translated: The exhaustion of life and the length of life,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos grub grub na rnal 'byor pas tshe zad pa dang tshe ring bar mthong ba ni 'di ni ring zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni thung zhes bya ba shes par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos grub grub na rnal 'byor pas tshe zad pa dang tshe ring bar mthong ba ni 'di ni ring zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni thung zhes bya ba shes par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
translated: If the adept sees the exhaustion of life and the length of life, he will know this is long and this is short.

original: sngon khyi dang glang po dang bong bu dang ba lang dang lug la sogs pa rnams shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon khyi dang glang po dang bong bu dang ba lang dang lug la sogs pa rnams shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not only that, he will know dogs, elephants, asses, cows, sheep, and so on.

original: de shes pas dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de shes pas dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of knowing that?

original: de grub pa yi skyes bur 'gyur //
analyzed: de grub pa yi skyes bur 'gyur //
translated: He becomes a person who has accomplished that,

original: skye ba bdun gyi rim pa yin //
analyzed: skye ba bdun gyi rim pa yin //
translated: the process of seven births,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: and so on.

original: dpal he ru ka bong bu'i rnam pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bcu bzhi ba'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka bong bu'i rnam pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bcu bzhi ba'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter on the procedure of glorious Heruka in the form of an ass from the commentary called Jewel Treasury on the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra.

original: // / skye ba bdun pa bshad pa'i las kyi sgrub pa bshad nas /
analyzed: // / skye ba bdun pa bshad pa'i las kyi sgrub pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the rite of practice of the seven-birth bodhisattva,

original: rgyud gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pa'i yul ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi tshig gis mkhas par khas 'ches pa rnams rmongs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor lo sngom pa'i rnal 'byor pa phan tshun du tha snyad du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pa'i yul ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi tshig gis mkhas par khas 'ches pa rnams rmongs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor lo sngom pa'i rnal 'byor pa phan tshun du tha snyad du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to generate confusion in those who are skilled in worldly speech and who claim to be yogis of other tantras, and in order to cause yogis of the Cakrasaṃvara tantra to engage in conventional terms with each other,

original: bde mchog 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa brtag pa'i phyir brda'i le'u bco lnga pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bde mchog 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa brtag pa'i phyir brda'i le'u bco lnga pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: and in order to examine those who are proud of being yogis of Cakrasaṃvara, the fifteenth chapter on the symbolics will be explained.

original: de nas sngom pa thams cad la //
analyzed: de nas sngom pa thams cad la //
translated: Then, all the vows

original: gang zhig brda ni shes gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig brda ni shes gyur pa //
translated: of one who knows the symbolics

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this,

original: dus dang yul dang sa dang / dbyangs dang gsal byed dang / dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dang / 'khor lo sngom pa'i mtshan gyi rgyud bla ma dang / kha sbyar 'byung ba dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba dang /🔽rnal 'byor ma kun du spyod pa'i rgyud rnams ni sdom pa thams cad do //🔽sngom pa de dag thams cad la rnal 'byor pa gang gis tshul ji lta ba bzhin du brda rnams shes pa de nges par 'grub par 'gyur zhes brda brjod pa'i dgos pa bstan to //🔽de ltar dgos pa dang ldan pa gang bstan zhe na /

Thus the purpose of the expression of signs is taught.🔽What is taught that has that purpose?🔽🔽

original: brda'o // de bzhin du yang thams cad la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brda'o // de bzhin du yang thams cad la blta bar bya'o //
translated: And so it is to be seen in all cases.🔽In the Sri-Paramadya-tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:

original: yi ge'i brda'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: yi ge'i brda'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
translated: The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: // / brda rnams bstan nas des 'jug pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i don du bza' ba dang bza' ba ma yin pa'i dam tshig gi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / brda rnams bstan nas des 'jug pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i don du bza' ba dang bza' ba ma yin pa'i dam tshig gi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: de nas // gsang ba'i bza' dang bza' min bshad //
analyzed: de nas // gsang ba'i bza' dang bza' min bshad //
translated: In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum po ni gsang ba'o //🔽byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bza' ba dang bza' bam yin pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum po ni gsang ba'o // byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bza' ba dang bza' bam yin pa'o //
translated: In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:

original: sgrub bo zhes bya ba ni sgrub ba po'i dam tshig bshad par bya ba'i don to //🔽de lta bu'i bza' ba gang du rnyed ce na /
analyzed: sgrub bo zhes bya ba ni sgrub ba po'i dam tshig bshad par bya ba'i don to //🔽de lta bu'i bza' ba gang du rnyed ce na /
translated: The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.🔽In the Sri-Cakra-Samvara-Pañca-Tattva-Tantra it is said:🔽The sign is the symbol.

original: dam tshig mchog la bza' ba gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dam tshig mchog la bza' ba gnas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The supreme pledge is the food.

original: dam tshig ni rigs rnam pa brgya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rigs rnam pa brgya'o //
translated: Here, “pledge” refers to the one hundred families.

original: rigs de dag gi mchog ni dam tshig mchog ste rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rigs de dag gi mchog ni dam tshig mchog ste rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi tshogs so //
translated: The supreme of those families is the supreme pledge, the assembly of the seven yoginīs.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i dam tshig gi mchog de la bza' ba'i khyad par rnyed ces ston par byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i dam tshig gi mchog de la bza' ba'i khyad par rnyed ces ston par byed de /
translated: The supreme pledge of the circle of yoginīs is the special food that is found.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i bza' ba gang su yang rung ba la sbyin nam /🔽'on te mi spyin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i bza' ba gang su yang rung ba la sbyin nam / 'on te mi spyin zhe na /
translated: Is that food given to anyone at all, or not?

original: dad ldan rnams la sbyin par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa ni gus pa dang ldan pa la sbyin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dad ldan rnams la sbyin par bya // zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa ni gus pa dang ldan pa la sbyin pa yin gyi /
translated: It is given to those who have faith.🔽Those who have faith are those who have devotion.

original: ma dad pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //🔽dad pa dang ldan pa rnams la sbyin pa ni re zhig gzhag na /
analyzed: ma dad pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro // dad pa dang ldan pa rnams la sbyin pa ni re zhig gzhag na /
translated: The special point is that it is given to those who have faith, not to those who do not have faith.

original: bza' ba yod pa'i rnal 'byor ma de gang zhe na /
analyzed: bza' ba yod pa'i rnal 'byor ma de gang zhe na /
translated: But if it is given to those who have faith, then what is the food of the yoginī?

original: kha dog dbye bas gsal ba gang //
analyzed: kha dog dbye bas gsal ba gang //
translated: The one who is clear by the division of color.

original: zhes bya ba la gang gis gsang ba de dag ni kha dog gi dbye ba ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang gis gsang ba de dag ni kha dog gi dbye ba ste ;
translated: The secret of those is the division of colors,🔽white, blue, and so on, which should be explained.

original: dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the previous phrase, should be explained.

original: de yang gang zhen /
analyzed: de yang gang zhen /
translated: And what is that?

original: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma //🔽zhes bya ba la dpa' bo ni rdo rje phag mo dang bdun te /
analyzed: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma // zhes bya ba la dpa' bo ni rdo rje phag mo dang bdun te /
translated: The hero, nondual, yoginī,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang drug go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang drug go //
translated: and so on. The hero is Vajravārāhī and the six, Vajrasattva, Vairocana, and so on.🔽Their nonduality is the nature of the form that is not other.

original: de dag gi gnyis su med pa ni gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin yang bud med nyid tsam gyis dbye ba'i dpa' bo gnyis med do //🔽de bas na dpa' bo yang yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyis su med pa ni gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin yang bud med nyid tsam gyis dbye ba'i dpa' bo gnyis med do // de bas na dpa' bo yang yin pas /
translated: The hero is nondual by the mere division of femininity.

original: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Therefore, he is a hero, and he is nondual, and he is a yoginī.

original: kha dog gi dbye bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog gi dbye bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the division of colors?

original: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely knowing which,

original: zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
translated: and so on. That is easy to understand.

original: @281b de'i rigs rgyud las byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @281b de'i rigs rgyud las byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lineage of that is the family.

original: rdo rje 'chang dang drug go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang drug go //
translated: Vajradhara is the sixth.

original: rdo rje phag mo dang bdun /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo dang bdun /
translated: Vajravārāhī is the seventh.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga ni rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga ni rigs lnga'o //
translated: The five buddhas beginning with Vairocana are the five families.

original: de las gzhan pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs las rigs gzhan te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs las rigs gzhan te /
translated: The other one is a different family from the Vajrasattva family.

original: rigs rgyud de las skyes pa ni rigs rgyud las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs rgyud de las skyes pa ni rigs rgyud las skyes pa'o //
translated: Born from that family lineage is one born from the family lineage.

original: rgyud 'de la lha mo kho na rigs yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud 'de la lha mo kho na rigs yin zhes bstan to //
translated: In this tantra, the goddesses alone are the families.

original: da bas na 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: da bas na 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught like this.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rigs rnams ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rigs rnams ni //
translated: The yoginīs are the families.

original: de ltar bdun po ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar bdun po ngas bshad do //
translated: Thus, I have explained the seven.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rnal 'byor ma ni rigs bdun kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni rigs bdun kho na yin te /
translated: the yoginīs are only the seven families.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su drug tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su drug tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata form is divided into six.

original: kha dog so sor bstan nas ;
analyzed: kha dog so sor bstan nas ;
translated: Having taught the individual colors,

original: spyod pa dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas rnal 'byor ma rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽g-yon pa'i kun spyod la rtag dga' //
analyzed: spyod pa dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas rnal 'byor ma rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir / g-yon pa'i kun spyod la rtag dga' //
translated: in order to teach the yoginīs from the perspective of conduct and seal,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, “Always delighting in left-side conduct,” and so on.

original: gtso bor gyur pa g-yon pa'i lag pa dang / rkang pa'i bya ba ni g-yon pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa g-yon pa'i lag pa dang / rkang pa'i bya ba ni g-yon pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The activity of the left hand and foot is the left conduct.

original: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya ni rang gi phyag rgya ste dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog go //
analyzed: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya ni rang gi phyag rgya ste dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog go //
translated: The consort who is in accord with the family is one's own consort, who is white, yellow, and so forth.

original: phyag rgya dang kha dog gnyis kyis dkrugs pa ni rang gi phyag rgya'i kha dog gis dkrugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang kha dog gnyis kyis dkrugs pa ni rang gi phyag rgya'i kha dog gis dkrugs pa'o //
translated: The mixing of the consort and color is the mixing of one's own consort's color.

original: rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba la /
translated: The syllables of the knowledge of the family are the syllables of the knowledge of the family.

original: rigs kyi rig pa ni rigs kyi skyes bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi rig pa ni rigs kyi skyes bu'o //
translated: The knowledge of the family is the person of the family.

original: de rnams kyi yi ge ni ming ste gang dang gang gi rigs gang yin pa de dang de'i dam tshig gi khyad par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yi ge ni ming ste gang dang gang gi rigs gang yin pa de dang de'i dam tshig gi khyad par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Their syllables are the names, which are the particular pledges of each family.

original: yang na rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rigs bdun no //
analyzed: yang na rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rigs bdun no //
translated: Alternatively, the syllables of the knowledge of the family are the seven families just explained.

original: rig pa yang bdun po yang de nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa yang bdun po yang de nyid do //
translated: The knowledge is also the seven.

original: rig pa de dag gam rig pa'i yi ge ni rig pa'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: rig pa de dag gam rig pa'i yi ge ni rig pa'i yi ge ste /
translated: Those knowledges or the syllables of the knowledge are the syllables of the knowledge.

original: aom dang ha la sogs pa nas phat kyi bar du tshig drug go //
analyzed: aom dang ha la sogs pa nas phat kyi bar du tshig drug go //
translated: The six words beginning with Om and Ha up to Phat are the seed syllables of the families.

original: bdun pa de dag thams cad ni rigs kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: bdun pa de dag thams cad ni rigs kyi yi ge'o //
translated: The seventh is the seed syllable of all of them.

original: aom dad pom la sogs pa nas phat kyi tshig drug po thim pa'i yi ge dang bdun pa ste /
analyzed: aom dad pom la sogs pa nas phat kyi tshig drug po thim pa'i yi ge dang bdun pa ste /
translated: The six words beginning with Om and Phat up to Phat are the seed syllables of the families.

original: rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The seventh is the seed syllable of the knowledge of the families.

original: rig pa yang yin la rigs kyi yi ge yang yin pas na rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: rig pa yang yin la rigs kyi yi ge yang yin pas na rigs kyi rig pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: Since it is both knowledge and the seed syllable of the families, it is the seed syllable of the knowledge of the families.

original: rigs gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i sa bon ni rang gi rigs kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: rigs gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i sa bon ni rang gi rigs kyi yi ge'o //
translated: The seed syllable of that and that family is the seed syllable of its own family.

original: dga' ba dang khro ba dang glo bur du brjod nas rnal 'byor ma yin par mtshon par bya'o zhes bstan to /
analyzed: dga' ba dang khro ba dang glo bur du brjod nas rnal 'byor ma yin par mtshon par bya'o zhes bstan to /
translated: It should be known that the expression of joy, anger, and the sudden utterance are not of the yoginis.

original: rang gi mdog dang yang dag rigs //
analyzed: rang gi mdog dang yang dag rigs //
translated: One should know one's own color and family.

original: zhes bya ba la dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni bshad zin to //
translated: The colors such as white, red, and so on have already been explained.

original: rang gi phyag rgya 'ching ba dang // zhes bya ba ni rang gi @282a * //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya 'ching ba dang // zhes bya ba ni rang gi @282a * //
translated: One should know one's own mudra.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i phyag rgya ston par byed do //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i phyag rgya ston par byed do //
translated: She displays a mudrā that is in keeping with her type.

original: rang gi rigs rgyud tshig tu smra //
analyzed: rang gi rigs rgyud tshig tu smra //
translated: She speaks the words of her own family lineage.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la rigs gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la rigs gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “she speaks” is that in order to make known the other families to Vajrasattva, she speaks.

original: g-yon nas 'gro ba'i bud med gang //
analyzed: g-yon nas 'gro ba'i bud med gang //
translated: A woman who goes by the left

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi g-yon pa'i rkang pa dang por bskyod pa de ni g-yon par 'gro ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi g-yon pa'i rkang pa dang por bskyod pa de ni g-yon par 'gro ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: means that she who moves her left foot first in whatever direction is said to go by the left.

original: rtag tu g-yon pa zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gzhan gyi g-yon nas 'gro ba de ni rtag tu g-yon par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i bud med de dag rnal 'byor ma yin zhes rtogs par bya'o //🔽dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: rtag tu g-yon pa zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gzhan gyi g-yon nas 'gro ba de ni rtag tu g-yon par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i bud med de dag rnal 'byor ma yin zhes rtogs par bya'o // dpal 'khor lo sngom pa'i dka' 'grel rin po che'i tshogs zhes bya ba las /
translated: She who is always on the left means that she who is always on the left of others is said to be one who is always on the left. One should understand that those mudrā women such as these are not yoginīs.

original: rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi mtshan nyid brtag pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi mtshan nyid brtag pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the chapter on the ritual of the examination of the characteristics of the seven yoginīs, the sixteenth chapter of the glorious Herukābhidhāna, the commentary on the tantra called the Jewel Heap.

original: // / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas ming brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas ming brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the yoginis, in order to state their names,

original: le'u bcu bdun pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: chapter seventeen is taught.

original: de nas rnyed dka' rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: de nas rnyed dka' rnal 'byor ma //
translated: Then, the difficult-to-attain yoginis,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on is stated.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni rab gtum mo la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dum skyes ma la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni rab gtum mo la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dum skyes ma la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The yoginis are the thirty-two dakinis beginning with Prachaandika, and the four beginning with Bhujaṅgī.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nang na rnyed par dka' zhing spyod yul ma yin pa de nyid kyi ming brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nang na rnyed par dka' zhing spyod yul ma yin pa de nyid kyi ming brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since they are difficult to attain and are not the domain of the yoginis and dakinis, their names should be stated.

original: rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro ma dag gi yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i dam tshig tu de la yang bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro ma dag gi yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i dam tshig tu de la yang bstan to //
translated: They are also taught as the commitments that are not even the domain of the yoginis and dakinis.

original: yang bshad pa dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang bshad pa dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Moreover, the intention is explained as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang a'a li k'a li mnyam par byas nas 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang a'a li k'a li mnyam par byas nas 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The Blessed One, having equalized the vowels and consonants, is the one with a nature of sixty-four petals.

original: de la re re'i yan lag dgu dgu'i gzugs 'phrog pa'i phyir de dag dpa' bo dang gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la re re'i yan lag dgu dgu'i gzugs 'phrog pa'i phyir de dag dpa' bo dang gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since each of them has nine limbs, they are the heroes and heroines.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rnyed par dka' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rnyed par dka' zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be difficult to attain for yoginis.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan yang cho ga dgod bya ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang cho ga dgod bya ba //
translated: Moreover, the arrangement of the rite

original: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma //
translated: is the nondual hero and heroine,

original: dpal ldan bde mchog rdo rje'i lha //
analyzed: dpal ldan bde mchog rdo rje'i lha //
translated: the glorious supreme vajra deity,

original: dug cu rtsa bzhis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: dug cu rtsa bzhis yongs su bskor //
translated: surrounded by the sixty-four.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: ji ltar dus kyi cha rnams gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus kyi cha rnams gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do the parts of time arise as the characteristics of form?🔽It is said:

original: bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Arising from the five nectars.

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five nectars are the five beginning with the mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: yang na chos kyi brda @282b ni bdud rtsi lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi brda @282b ni bdud rtsi lnga'o //
translated: Or, the five nectars are the symbols of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: sems can gyi don la chags pa ni khrag go //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la chags pa ni khrag go //
translated: Blood is the passion for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: chos rnams ma skyes pa ni shukra'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ma skyes pa ni shukra'o //
translated: Semen is the non-arising of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni sha'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni sha'o //
translated: The equality of all things is the rice.

original: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa ni chu'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa ni chu'o //
translated: The state of equality is the water.

original: dbye ba mi dmigs pa ni bshang ba'o //
analyzed: dbye ba mi dmigs pa ni bshang ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of distinctions is the excrement.

original: yang na dam tshig can gyi skye bo rab tu grub pa'i bdud rtsi lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na dam tshig can gyi skye bo rab tu grub pa'i bdud rtsi lnga'o //
translated: Or else, the five nectars are the five nectars of the accomplished being who is committed to the commitments.

original: de rnams kyi rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba ni phul du byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung zhes bya ba ste skyon med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba ni phul du byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung zhes bya ba ste skyon med do //
translated: The arising of those in accordance with their type is the arising from the five excellent nectars.

original: yang na phyogs snga ma bzhin bya ste /
analyzed: yang na phyogs snga ma bzhin bya ste /
translated: Or else, the former position is to be maintained.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid dang ming rnams la tshol bas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid dang ming rnams la tshol bas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: What is the use of searching for their characteristics and names?

original: bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud rtsi lnga rnams su'am /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga las yang dag 'byung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud rtsi lnga rnams su'am /
translated: Arising from the five nectars

original: bdud rtsi lnga rnams kyi nang nas dam pa ni phul du byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga rnams kyi nang nas dam pa ni phul du byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga ste /
translated: and so on. The five nectars are the five excellent nectars.

original: de bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po can /
analyzed: de bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po can /
translated: They are the essence of the five nectars.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'byung zhing yang dag par 'byung bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'byung zhing yang dag par 'byung bar gyur pa ni /
translated: The thought of awakening arises and is truly arisen.

original: le'u bcu gcig par gyur par bshad pa'i skye ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi snod du rung pa'i phyir btsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig par gyur par bshad pa'i skye ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi snod du rung pa'i phyir btsal ba yin gyi /
translated: The arising of the bodhicitta, which is the true arising, is the search for the one who is a fit vessel for the bodhicitta, which has the characteristics of the seven lives explained in the eleventh chapter.

original: dngos grub kyi skal ba mi ldan zhing tha dad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi skal ba mi ldan zhing tha dad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not for others who are not endowed with the good fortune of power and who have the fault of being different.🔽But what about the one who is said to have supreme wisdom?

original: de lta mod kyi shes rab mchog / ces bya ba gang zhe na /🔽gshin rje ma dang skrag byed ma //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi shes rab mchog / ces bya ba gang zhe na / gshin rje ma dang skrag byed ma // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one who is called the one who is supreme is the one who is called the one who is supreme in the verse that goes:

original: gshin rje ma dang skrag byed ma dang // zlog byed ma dang / 'jigs gzugs can ma dang / kun spyod ma dang / 'od ldan ma ste /🔽mkha' 'gro ma bdun no //
analyzed: gshin rje ma dang skrag byed ma dang // zlog byed ma dang / 'jigs gzugs can ma dang / kun spyod ma dang / 'od ldan ma ste /🔽mkha' 'gro ma bdun no //
translated: The one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is supreme, the one who is

original: kye ma 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar byed pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi nang na med cing chos kyi yi ge la sogs pa'i nang na yang med ;
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar byed pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi nang na med cing chos kyi yi ge la sogs pa'i nang na yang med ;
translated: Oh! This is the mandala of the most amazing, which is not among the thirty-six yoginis, and is not among the dharmam syllables, etc.

original: so sor yang ma bstan de nas kyang lnga'am bcu'am mang du yang bsdus par mi snang ba de'i tshe de dag gang yin zhes de dag bstan par rigs na /
analyzed: so sor yang ma bstan de nas kyang lnga'am bcu'am mang du yang bsdus par mi snang ba de'i tshe de dag gang yin zhes de dag bstan par rigs na /
translated: When it is not taught individually, and when it does not appear to be summarized into five, ten, or more, at that time, it is appropriate to teach what are they?

original: de dag kyang ma bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma bstan to //
translated: But they are not taught.

original: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ma bdun ni ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyud las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ma bdun ni ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyud las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the seven yoginis with distinctions should be followed in the explanatory tantra in order to realize what is not realized.

original: de la rgyud du nyi shu rtsa bzhi po drug gis bsdus so //
analyzed: de la rgyud du nyi shu rtsa bzhi po drug gis bsdus so //
translated: There, in the tantra, the twenty-four are included in the six.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: There, it should be explained:

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gtso mo ste //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gtso mo ste //
translated: The chief of the vajra mandala,

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams yang dag bshad //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams yang dag bshad //
translated: the dakinis are rightly explained.

original: rnal 'byor ma drug de shes bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug de shes bya //
translated: The six yoginis should be known,

original: kla klo'i skad du gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: kla klo'i skad du gsungs pa yin //
translated: spoken in the language of the barbarians.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: da la kla klo'i @283a * //
analyzed: da la kla klo'i @283a * //
translated: Now, the barbarian language

original: brda ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: brda ni 'di yin te /
translated: is as follows.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma dang brtson 'grus chen mo ste mkha' 'gro ma gnyis bo ma mo zhes bya ba'i brdar brjod /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma dang brtson 'grus chen mo ste mkha' 'gro ma gnyis bo ma mo zhes bya ba'i brdar brjod /
translated: The two dakinis Cakravarmi and Mahāvīryā are called “mother” in the code language.

original: shin tu dpa' mo dang stobs chen mo ni rigs kyi 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu dpa' mo dang stobs chen mo ni rigs kyi 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Suvīrā and Mahābalā are called “family leader” in the code language.

original: ma mo dang rigs kyi 'dren pa de gnyis gshin rje ma dang gzugs can ma zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ma mo dang rigs kyi 'dren pa de gnyis gshin rje ma dang gzugs can ma zhes bya'o ;
translated: Those two, mother and family leader, are called “Yama” and “Rūpiṇī.”

original: / de ltar gzhan thams cad la yang shes par bya'o //🔽ko sko can dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni rigs kyi lha mo'o //
analyzed: / de ltar gzhan thams cad la yang shes par bya'o // ko sko can dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni rigs kyi lha mo'o //
translated: One should understand all the others in this way.🔽Karkoṭā and Cakravarmiṇī are “family goddesses.”

original: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma dang / dum skyes ma ni byis pa mo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma dang / dum skyes ma ni byis pa mo'o //
translated: Cakravīriṇī and Khaṇḍarohā are “girls.”

original: de gnyis kyang skrag byed tsum bi ka'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang skrag byed tsum bi ka'o //
translated: Those two are also “Cumbikā, the terrifying one.”

original: rta rna ma dang bya gdong ma ni lhan cig skyas pa'i gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: rta rna ma dang bya gdong ma ni lhan cig skyas pa'i gzugs can ma'o //
translated: Hayakarṇī and Hayānanā are “Sahajā, the one with a form.”

original: ljang lha mo dang shin tu bzang mo ni brtul zhugs spyod ma ste /
analyzed: ljang lha mo dang shin tu bzang mo ni brtul zhugs spyod ma ste /
translated: Harī and Subhadrā are “the one who practices discipline.”

original: de gnyis kyang ri'i lha mo nyid l'a ma'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang ri'i lha mo nyid l'a ma'o //
translated: Those two are also Alama.

original: rlung gi shugs can ma dang chang 'thung ma ni sha za ma'o //
analyzed: rlung gi shugs can ma dang chang 'thung ma ni sha za ma'o //
translated: Vayuvega and Surābhakṣi are Piśācī.

original: sa srung ma dang 'jigs byed chen mo ni sbom pa'i dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: sa srung ma dang 'jigs byed chen mo ni sbom pa'i dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: Vasudhārā and Mahābhairavā are Padminī.

original: de gnyis kyang 'jigs byed ma'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang 'jigs byed ma'o //
translated: Those two are also Bhairavī.

original: de gnyis zlog byed ma zhes kyang brjod do //🔽langka'i dbang phyug ma dang / shing grib ma gnyis ni khanda ro h'i'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zlog byed ma zhes kyang brjod do // langka'i dbang phyug ma dang / shing grib ma gnyis ni khanda ro h'i'o //
translated: Those two are also called Nivāraṇaviṣkambhinī.🔽Laṅkeśvarī and Vṛkṣā🔽sthā are Khaṇḍarohā.

original: brtan pa'i blo gros ma dang mi thung ma ni bu mo ste /
analyzed: brtan pa'i blo gros ma dang mi thung ma ni bu mo ste /
translated: Dṛḍhabuddhi and Vāmana are Dārikā.

original: de gnyis kyang kun spyod ma dang byis bcas ma'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang kun spyod ma dang byis bcas ma'o //
translated: Those two are also Samācārā and Sādhā.

original: 'od ldan ma dang sna chen ma ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //🔽rab gtum ma dang gtum mig ma ni mkha' 'gro ma dang dam pa'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: 'od ldan ma dang sna chen ma ni mkha' 'gro ma'o // rab gtum ma dang gtum mig ma ni mkha' 'gro ma dang dam pa'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: Prabhāvatī and Mahānāsā are Dākinī.🔽Pracaṇḍā and Caṇḍākṣī are Dākinī and Ugradevī.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang dam pa'i dbang phyug ma gnyis ni ba su ra dang mi ldog ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang dam pa'i dbang phyug ma gnyis ni ba su ra dang mi ldog ma'o //
translated: Dākinī and Ugradevī are Vāsukī and Avatāra.

original: bdun pa ni dpa' bo'i blo gros ma chen mo ste tshu rol ma'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni dpa' bo'i blo gros ma chen mo ste tshu rol ma'o //
translated: The seventh is Mahāvīrabuddhi, who is Pārśvī.

original: rgyud 'di las bdun las lhag par ni ma gsungs kyi sdud par byed ma zhes bya ba yang gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyud 'di las bdun las lhag par ni ma gsungs kyi sdud par byed ma zhes bya ba yang gsungs so //
translated: This Tantra does not speak of more than seven lineages, but it does speak of a “compiler.”

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs bdun no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs bdun no //
translated: Therefore, there are seven lineages of yoginis.

original: mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa de'i ming can du 'gyur zhing de'i mtshan nyid dang ming sngon du 'gro ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa de'i ming can du 'gyur zhing de'i mtshan nyid dang ming sngon du 'gro ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics and names of those who possess those characteristics,

original: gzugs can ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “Rupika, etc.,”

original: gzugs can ma dang tsum bi ka dang / l'a ma dang yongs su gyur pa dang / byis bcas ma dang / mi zlogs ma dang / tshu rol dang / mkha' 'gro ma bdun po ni yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma dang tsum bi ka dang / l'a ma dang yongs su gyur pa dang / byis bcas ma dang / mi zlogs ma dang / tshu rol dang / mkha' 'gro ma bdun po ni yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: and the seven dakinis, Rupika, Cumbika, Lamika, Paravrtta, Balyasa, Atyayika, and Patalika, are included.

original: gnyis med dpa' bo bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: gnyis med dpa' bo bsdu bar bya //
translated: “The hero of nonduality is included.”

original: zhes bya ba la dpa' bo ni dpal bde mchog 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pa des gnyis su med pa'i dngos grub spyod pa'i dpa' bo gnyis @283b med bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dpa' bo ni dpal bde mchog 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pa des gnyis su med pa'i dngos grub spyod pa'i dpa' bo gnyis @283b med bstan pa ste /
translated: The hero is the yogi of Sri Chakrasamvara. The hero of nonduality is taught to be the hero who practices the nondual spiritual power.

original: bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu gsal ba'i phyag rgya khong du chud par bya'o //🔽slar yang phyag rgya dag gis kyang //🔽de dag mtshon par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu gsal ba'i phyag rgya khong du chud par bya'o // slar yang phyag rgya dag gis kyang // de dag mtshon par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: One should understand the mudrā that has the characteristic of being explained, which is very clear.

original: thod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, in order to illustrate those, he says, “skull, etc.”

original: thod pa dang / dgra sta dang / mche ba dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / rgyal mtshan dang / khatv'am ga nyid kun du skrag par byed pas kun du skrag byed do //
analyzed: thod pa dang / dgra sta dang / mche ba dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / rgyal mtshan dang / khatv'am ga nyid kun du skrag par byed pas kun du skrag byed do //
translated: Skull, axe, tusk, wheel, vajra, banner, khaṭvāṅga—since they terrify, they are terrifying.

original: phyag rgya'o // 'dir ma bshad pa ni sdud par byed /
analyzed: phyag rgya'o // 'dir ma bshad pa ni sdud par byed /
translated: The mudrā is not explained here, but is included.

original: kha gdong ma la sogs pa bzhin phyag rgya brgyad pa ni dung ngo //
analyzed: kha gdong ma la sogs pa bzhin phyag rgya brgyad pa ni dung ngo //
translated: The eight mudrās, such as the face-to-face, are the conch.

original: mkha' spyod dang / sa spyod dang / sa 'og na gnas pa gsum dang / mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi po dang / shes rab kyi padma dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo gsum du 'dus so //
analyzed: mkha' spyod dang / sa spyod dang / sa 'og na gnas pa gsum dang / mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi po dang / shes rab kyi padma dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo gsum du 'dus so //
translated: The three, the sky-goer, the earth-goer, and the underworld-goer, and the four, the ḍākinī, etc., and the three wheels together with the wisdom lotus are included.

original: rnal 'byor ma bdun ni 'khor lo thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ma ste /
